head.title: Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. - Page #12

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #12 of 32 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Umfreville, Edward. Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0030

div.p: which runs out of it)[.] Port. is 340yds over, & midg road, then entd a lac, went to ye end of it, WSW1¼ to a small Creek, went to the end of it ½m. to anr Port. 300yds over – then a Swamp abt 200yds long, at the end of wch a Portage 500yds long, partly choaked up (NB. The 3 last Portages are called les trois Port. de Port. Noir)[.] From last Port. entd a River, stony, shoaly (& bad loading) at ye beging afterwds opens into a lac with sevl small Is in it – the Riv. is abt 120yds over, went in it W3m. pass'd an opening on the Lt which appear'd like the Junction of a small lac – then SW1m. to a rocky Islet, left it on the Rt –then ¾ to a grassy pt – from this pt ¼ to the mouth of a Creek on the Lt it afterwds opens into a smal[l] Lac, went in it to its end abt 1m. to Port. Les Pêches 500yds long & good road. Then entd a lac SWbW to a pt on the other side 1½m. – rod ye pt ½m. – WbS1m. across a bay on Lt – SWbW¾ – here the lac draws up in the form of a bold Creek went in it 1m. & turn'd immediately rod a pt to Port. Catteaux, 80yds over & good road, leavg the Port. abt 70yds to a pt across a bay – then WSW2m. – WbS1m to a Creek, which in abt ¼m. terminates in a Swamp, abt 40yds up this on Rt is Port. Brulè Bushè 135yds long, by the Swamp into another small lac, pass'd the Canoe in it part of the way, & carried ye remainder, then rod a pt across ye lac ¼m. SW. to Port. le Gros Galais 450yds long & good road over a rock[.] From this Port. the Currt descends Westerly.

July 5 Monday. From ye end of the Port. a small lac, cross'd it into an opening like a Creek, which ends in a Swamp went to the end of it 1¼ to Port. Brulè 670yds long, (& after clearing away a little) a tolerable road. Part of the Passage to ye Port. was so shallow, that we were oblig'd to ½ unload ye Canoe, but the Guide says the water is lower than comon, leaving the Port. cross'd a Small lac NWbW abt 200yds to anr opening like a River, went to ye end of it, wch is broad 1m. to Port. des Grosses Roches, in the Co of this mile, pass'd another openg on the Rt which appears like a Strait into another lac. Last Port. 430yds long & bad road over sharp rocks, then entd a narrow lac, went to the end ¾m. to Port. de Calumet, 160yds over & good road – then entd a lac NWbW¾m. from hence (as usual) the lac drains up to a narrow Channel, went to the end 2m. to Port. Savanne 450yds long, & road mostly swampy, then entd narrow lac 1¼m. long, (leaving a channel on Rt) to Port. de Ram 90 yds long, & good road – then a lac (which appears from the Port. to be of a square form) NWbW to a pt on Lt 3/4m. – NW¼ across a bay, to a grassy pt – then entd a narrow Strait ½m. long into anr lac (the Strait has plenty of water in it, but sevl large Stones being under water makes it necessary to be cautious) after leavg ye Strait Wt ¾ to a pt sevl large Stones above water – SWbS¾ – WSW½, 3 Islds on Rt & 3 small ones on Lt also sevl Stones appear above water in this Co – WSW¾ to a pt on Rt on wch side pass'd one Id & another on ye Lt – then SbE2½, having sevl Is on Lt & the end of the lac on Rt[.] This brought us to Port. Campion 160yds over a good road. NB. As this Port. is not very easy for a stranger to find (on Acct of the No of small Is) it is necessary to mention that at the beging of it sevl Trees are bark'd, & on the Rt is a small run of water, with large Stones at its mouth[.] The numerous small Lakes wch we pass are Join'd by small drains of water, the passing of which makes the […] At a Port. this day Dubay, one of our men narrowly miss'd mutilation

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
